reserved article iv  alarm systems purpose a the purpose of this article is to encourage alarm users and alarm companies to properly use and maintain the operational effectiveness of alarm systems in order to improve the reliability of alarm systems and reduce or eliminate false alarms b this article governs alarm systems intended to summon law enforcement response and requires registration establishes fees provides for penalties for violations establishes a system of administration and sets conditions for suspension of police response or revocation of registration  101805 definitions for the purposes of this chapter the following definitions shall apply unless the content requires a different definition alarm protective service means any service whereby the person providing such service installs services repairs maintains sells replaces or responds to an alarm system or which causes any of the activities to take place for the purposes of this chapter alarm protective services shall not include any persons engaged solely in the sale of alarm systems designed to cause an audible andor visual signal to be emitted only in or on the premises in which the system is installed alarm site means a single premises or location one street address served by an alarm system or systems that are under the control of one owner alarm system means any assembly of equipment device or devices arranged to signal the presence of a hazard requiring urgent attention and to which police are expected to respond the term alarm system shall include the terms automatic holdup alarm system burglar alarm system holdup alarm system and manual holdup alarm system as those terms are hereinafter defined for the purpose of this chapter an alarm system shall not include 1 fire alarm systems and other alarm systems that monitor temperature humidity or any other condition not directly related to the detection of an unauthorized intrusion into a premises or an attempted robbery at a premises 2 an alarm system installed on a motor vehicle 3 an alarm system designed to alert only the inhabitants of a premises that does not have a local alarm alarm system user means the owner agent or person in control of the property on which an alarm system or systems is maintained within the corporate limits of the city automatic dialing device means an alarm system which automatically sends over regular telephone lines by direct connection or otherwise a prerecorded voice message or coded signal indicating the existence of the emergency situation that the alarm system is designed to detect automatic holdup alarm system means an alarm system in which the signal transmission is initiated by the action of a robber burglar alarm system means an alarm system signaling an entry or attempted entry into an area protected by the alarm system chief means the chief of police of the city of pasadena texas or representative designated by such chief duress alarm means the deliberate activation of a silent alarm by entering at a keypad a code that is different from the normal armdisarm code or by a separate deliberate act at another device false alarm means any activation of an alarm system or electronic failure malfunction improper installation negligence of the owner agent or person in control of the property or any other such activation which is not a result of an emergency or threat of emergency for which the alarm system was designed to give notice and for which the responding police officer arrives within thirty 30 minutes after receipt of the alarm notification and finds no evidence of any criminal activity for the purpose of this chapter a false alarm shall not include any activation of an alarm system to which the response by the police department is cancelled by the alarm protective service prior to arrival of responding police officer at the property on which the alarm system causing the response is located holdup alarm system means an alarm system signaling a robbery or attempted robbery manual holdup alarm system means an alarm system in which the signal transmission is initiated by the direct action of the persons attacked or by an observer of the attack monitoring means the process by which an alarm company receives signals from an alarm system and relays an alarm notification to the city panic alarm means an audible or silent alarm generated by the deliberate activation of a panic device permit means a certificate of authorization issued by the police department to the owner agent or person in control of the property which authorizes the operation of an alarm system of systems at an alarm site permit holder means any individual corporation partnership association organization or other entity to whom an alarm system permit is issued person means any individual corporation partnership association organization or other entity  101805 permit application  issuance a it shall be unlawful for any person to operate cause to be operated or permit the operation of an alarm system or systems at an alarm site unless a valid permit has been issued by the police department for such system this requirement shall not be applicable to an alarm protective service unless the alarm protective service is the owner agent or person in control of the property which the alarm system is designed to protect an alarm system user shall be in violation of this chapter if he permits the operation of such system without a proper permit b an alarm system user or his agent shall obtain an annual permit for each alarm site c application for a permit or renewal for the operation of an alarm system or systems at an alarm site shall be made with the police department by the owner agent or person having control over the property on which the alarm system is to be installed and operated application shall be made in writing on a form designated by the city on such application form the applicant shall set forth 1 the name address and two 2 telephone numbers of the owner agent or person in control of the property to be protected  2 the street address of the property on which the alarm system is to be installed and operated  3 a brief description of the type of property to be protected ie commercial residential or industrial etc  4 any business name or title used for the premises on which the alarm system is to be installed and operated  5 name address and telephone number of the monitoring company and alarm installation company that will install and service the alarm system 6 names and telephone numbers of one or more persons who are able to and have agreed to receive notification at any time from the police department in order to deactivate the alarm system if it becomes necessary  7 any other pertinent information required by the police department which is necessary for the enforcement of the charter d the police department shall issue a permit to the individual corporation or other legal entity in control of the property to be protected upon submission in person or by mail of a completed application and payment of the appropriate fee unless any statement made in the application is incomplete or false incomplete or false application information will result in rejection of the application e the police department shall treat all information on the application as confidential f any permit issued pursuant of this chapter shall be applicable only to the permit holder and is not transferable g each permit issued to an alarm system user shall be valid for a oneyear period unless one of the following occurs earlier 1 control of protected property is transferred from the permit holder  2 permit holder voluntarily discontinues services provided by a particular alarm protective service andor disconnects alarm system  3 revocation of the permit by the police department pursuant to section 3078 h the annual fee for a permit issued pursuant to this chapter shall be 1 fifteen dollars $1500 for a residential alarm site  2 fifteen dollars $1500 for a residential unit of an apartment complex  and 3 thirty dollars $3000 for a commercial alarm site including an apartment complex  101805 permit duration and renewal 1 a permit expires one year from the date of issuance and must be renewed annually by submitting an updated application and a permit renewal fee in accordance with section 3073 of this chapter before terminating a permit for nonrenewal the chief shall provide thirty 30 days prior written notice to the permit holder of the need to renew the permit and file an updated permit application 2 the chief may refuse to renew a permit for an alarm system that has had eight 8 or more false alarms during the calendar year january 1   101805   121906 proper alarm system operation and maintenance a a permit holder or person in control of an alarm system shall 1 maintain premises containing an alarm system in a manner that ensures proper operation of the alarm system  2 maintain the alarm system in a manner that will minimize false alarm notifications  3 respond or cause a representative to respond within a reasonable period of time when notified by the city to repair or inactivate a malfunctioning alarm system to provide access to the premises or to provide security for the premises  and 4 not intentionally activate an alarm for any reason other than an occurrence of an event that the alarm system was intended to report b a person in control of a local alarm shall adjust the mechanism or cause the mechanism to be adjusted so that an alarm signal after being activated will sound for no longer than 1 thirty 30 minutes for an alarm system installed before  except as otherwise provided in subsection b2b of this section  and 2 ten 10 minutes for an alarm system a installed on or after   or b installed before  but to which any improvement is made on or after  c the police department shall refuse police response to any alarm notification from an alarm site that does not have a valid permit unless the alarm notification was a duress alarm a hold up alarm a panic alarm or reported to a 911 emergency telephone number or to the police department by a person other than an alarm company  101805 monitoring procedures any alarm company engaged in the business of monitoring alarm systems in the city shall 1 report alarm signals only by using telephone numbers designated by the chief  2 before requesting police response to an alarm signal attempt to verify every alarm signal except a duress hold up or panic alarm activation  a for the purposes of this section verify means an attempt by the monitoring company or its representatives to contact the alarm site andor alarm user by telephone andor other electronic means whether or not actual contact with a person is made to determine whether an alarm signal is valid before requesting law enforcement dispatch in an attempt to avoid an unnecessary alarm dispatch request for the purpose of this article telephone verification shall require as a minimum that a second call be made to a different number if the first attempt fails to reach an alarm user who can properly identify themselves to determine whether an alarm signal is valid before requesting law enforcement dispatch 3 when reporting an alarm notification to the city provide the alarm permit number and address of the alarm site from which the alarm notification originated  and 4 communicate alarm notifications to the city in a manner and form determined by the chief  101805 penalty fee for city responses to excessive false alarms a for each false alarm the city will assess a penalty fee as follows 1 fifty dollars $5000 if the location has had more than three 3 but fewer than six 6 other false alarms in the calendar year january 1   2 seventyfive dollars $7500 if the location has had more than five 5 but fewer than eight 8 other false alarms in the calendar year january 1   or 3 one hundred dollars $10000 if the location has had eight 8 or more other false alarms in the calendar year january 1  b upon new alarm installation the alarm company will not call the police department dispatch for response for the first seven 7 days after installation the monitoring company shall not make an alarm dispatch request of a law enforcement agency in response to a burglar alarm signal excluding panic duress and holdup signals during the first seven 7 days following an alarm system installation the police chief may grant an alarm users request for an exemption from this waiting period based upon a determination that special circumstances substantiate the need for the exemption c a permit holder will not be assessed a penalty fee for a response to notification of the activation of an alarm system if the permit holder shows to the police chief or his designated representative that the activation was not a false alarm and any response by the police department to such notification of an alarm system will not be included in determining the penalty fee set out above for the purposes of determining the penalty fee set out above the burden shall be on the permit holder to prove that the activation of the alarm system was not a false alarm d the police officer responding to a false alarm shall place a notice in a visible location on a window of the location for which the false alarm was reported advising of the responding officers name and time and date of the response to the false alarm  101805   121906 revocation of permits a the chief of police may revoke an alarm system permit if he determines that 1 there is a false statement of a material matter on the application for a permit  2 the permit holder has violated this chapter or any of its provisions  or 3 the permit holder has failed to make timely payment of a penalty fee assessed under section 3077 within thirty 30 days of mailed notification to permit holder 4 the permit holder has had eight 8 or more false alarms during the calendar year january 1  b it shall be unlawful for any person to operate an alarm system during the period in which his alarm permit is revoked c a permit holder or person in control of an alarm system shall attempt to resolve the revocation or denial of a permit with the chief or his designated representative before filing an appeal as described in section 3079 d the fee for reinstatement of any permit after revocation shall be two hundred fifty dollars $25000 this fee however shall not apply to any reinstatement made pursuant to an appeal under section 3079  101805   91206   121906 appeal from penalty fee  denial or revocation of a permit a any permit holder aggrieved by the decision to assess a penalty fee by the chief of police or his designated representative as provided for in section 3077 may appeal the decision to a judge of the pasadena municipal court by filing with the city secretary a written request for a hearing setting forth the reasons for the appeal within ten 10 days after the chief of police or his designated representative renders the decision the filing of a request for an appeal hearing with the city secretary stays an action of the chief of police in assessing a penalty fee until a judge makes a final decision if a request for an appeal hearing is not made within the tenday period the action of the chief of police or his designated representative is final b if the chief of police refuses to issue or revokes a permit he shall send to the applicant or permit holder by certified mail return receipt requested written notice of his action and a statement of the right to an appeal the applicant or permit holder may appeal the decision of the chief of police to a judge of the pasadena municipal court by filing with the city secretary a written request for a hearing setting forth the reasons for the appeal within ten 10 days after receipt or the notice from the chief of police the standards and procedures to be followed by any alarm protective service when giving notice to the police department or activation of an alarm system such standards and procedures shall be set out in writing and made available to any alarm system business requesting same b it shall be unlawful for a person to operate or cause to be operated any automatic dialing device which when activated uses a telephone device or attachment to automatically select a telephone line leading into the communication center of the police department and then transmits any prerecorded message or signal  101805 violations  penalty  corporations partnerships and associations a an alarm company an alarm permit holder or a person in control of an alarm system commits an offense if he violates any provision of this article by either commission of an act that is forbidden or omission of a duty or responsibility imposed upon him by this article b a person who violates a provision of this article is guilty of a separate offense for each day or portion of a day during which the violation is committed continued or permitted each offense is punishable by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 and not less than 1 two hundred dollars $20000 for the first conviction  and 2 two hundred fifty dollars $25000 for the second and each subsequent conviction c in addition to prohibiting or requiring certain conduct of individuals it is the intent of this article to hold a corporation partnership or other association criminally responsible for acts or omissions performed by an agent acting in behalf of the corporation partnership or other association and within the scope of employment  101805 alarm system operating instructions a person in control of an alarm system shall maintain at each alarm site a complete set of written operating instructions for each alarm system special codes combination or passwords must not be included in these instructions  101805 system performance reviews if there is reason to believe that an alarm system is not being used or maintained in a manner that ensures proper operation to suppress false alarms the chief may require a conference to review the circumstances of each false alarm with the alarm permit holder and the alarm company under contract with the alarm permit holder a person may be issued a citation for failing to attend a system performance review after receiving notice of the conference from the chief  101805 standard sign code footnotes  1  editors note  adopted jan 7 199 repealed former ch 31  3113115 in its entirety 3113118 in its entirety the former provisions pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  1795   82796   7 815 6397   7897   81297   112597   2 48 9 3398   61698   2 9898 cross reference building and building regulations ch 9  application of electrical code to signs  1221  sign required on premises of drivein restaurant  2060  pipeline signs obstructing or encroaching upon streets and alleys  323  street banners  3244 et seq purpose it is the purpose and intent of this chapter to regulate signs and to authorize the use of signs that are compatible with their surroundings that are legible under the circumstances in which they are seen that are effective in indexing the environment and that are conducive to promoting traffic safety and the convenience and enjoyment of public travel by preventing visual distractions protecting pedestrians attracting visitors to the city preserving and enhancing property values promoting firstclass business and commercial districts and eliminating fire hazards it is also the intention and purpose of this chapter to promote short and longterm civic beauty and order by establishing standards and regulations for sign design location size type compatibility and aesthetics by doing so it is hoped this chapter will help to create streetscapes that are functional and attractive to both residents and visitors of pasadena  92600 scope the intent is to regulate within the corporate and extraterritorial jurisdiction of the city of pasadena texas the design and placement of all signs commercial and governmental identificationcommunication devices and structures that are built specifically to identify inform and direct patrons to a particular merchant store establishment or service it is not the intent of this chapter to regulate the content of public speech the regulations of this chapter are intended to apply to both onpremises and offpremises signs but do not apply to handheld placards and other similar devices traditionally used for public protest and the exercise of free speech any noncommercial message may be substituted for any commercial message permitted under this chapter  92600   superiority clause if any subdivision or individual tract of land contains restrictions or covenants relating to signs or any person or persons enter into a legally binding agreement which provides for the regulating of signs in a particular development and for more restrictive than these regulations the more restrictive requirements shall apply  92600   enforcement any sign not expressly allowed by this chapter is prohibited  92600 definitions the following definitions shall apply to this chapter 1 advertising shall mean to seek the attraction or direct the attention of the public to any goods services or merchandise whatsoever or a location that provides goods services or merchandise 2 alterations or repair to an advertising display shall mean repairs or improvements to a display sign or sign structure not exceeding fifty 50 per cent replacement value 3 banner shall mean any waterresistant fabric or material on which there appears a display typically supported at both ends 4 business shall mean the erection or use of any property building or structure permanent or temporary for the primary purpose of conducting in said building or structure or on said property a legitimate commercial enterprise in compliance with all ordinances and regulations of the city of pasadena governing such activity  business purpose shall not include any property building or structure erected or used for the primary purpose of securing a permit or erecting a sign 5 city shall mean the city of pasadena texas 6 display shall mean the message of any sign whether it be in words symbols or objects 7 embellishment shall mean structural or decorative elements of a sign incorporating representations of the significant architectural features of the associated building or development embellishment shall not include letters numerals figures emblems logos or other features conveying a commercial advertising message 8 face shall mean the total display area and border of a sign 9 federal primary system shall mean the interstate and freeway primary system and the nonfreeway primary system 10 intersection shall mean the intersection of streets driveways alleys or any two 2 surfaces intended for motor vehicles 11 interstate and freeway primary system shall mean the portion of the national system of interstate and defense highways located within texas which now or hereafter may be officially designated the interstate system by the texas highway and public transportation commission and approved pursuant to title 3 united states as amended 12 nameplate shall mean a nonelectrical sign identifying only the name and occupation or profession of the occupant or occupants of premises on which the sign is located and not exceeding six 6 inches by eighteen 18 inches 13 nonfreeway primary system shall mean that portion of the connective main highway located within texas which now or hereafter may be officially designated the primary system by the texas highway and public transportation commission and approved pursuant to title 23 united states as amended 14 owner shall mean the person who owns or leases the onpremises sign the owner of the offpremises sign or the owner of the real property on which the sign whether it be onpremises or offpremises is located 15 person shall mean an individual company corporation partnership association or any other entity 16 primarily residential area shall mean the rightofway and adjoining property area between two 2 intersecting public streets in which a majority of the total front footage is used for residential purposes 17 public street shall mean the entire width between property lines of any road street way alley bridge or other similar thoroughfare not privately owned or controlled when any part thereof is open to the public for vehicular traffic is the responsibility of the city or other similar public agency to maintain and is over which the city has legislative jurisdiction under its police power 18 relocate shall mean the removal of a sign and any supporting structure from one 1 location and placing it or its replacement at a new location even if the relocation is to a place on the same lot or parcel of property 19 residential purposes shall mean property devoted to use as a singlefamily or multifamily residence residential purposes shall include but not be limited to property used for houses duplexes condominiums town houses town homes patio homes and apartments property used for hotels motels and boarding houses shall not be considered as used for residential purposes property devoted to both residential and nonresidential use shall be considered as used for residential purposes 20 rightofway shall mean the property fronting or immediately adjacent to and on either side of a public street or a nonpublic street which the public authority has the authority to use for the road or street 21 sight triangle shall mean the triangle formed at an intersection by intersecting curb lines and a noncurb line joining the curb lines the triangle is formed by a motorists view of oncoming traffic when exiting a private drive or at the intersection of two 2 or more public streets the motorists eye is assumed to be at a point fifteen 15 feet from the edge of the roadway traffic must be visible for a distance of ten 10 times the speed limit on either side of the vehicle parallel to the intersecting roadway no sign shall be placed in or above the triangular area created by the motorists view described by this subsection see illustrations 21 and 31 22 sight distance is the minimum visibility distance parallel to the curb lines that must be preserved this distance is ten 10 times the speed limit in miles per hour of the intersecting public roadway 23 sign shall mean an outdoor structure sign display light device figure painting drawing message plaque poster billboard or other thing that is designed intended or used to advertise or inform each separate message shall be considered a sign 24 sign administrator shall mean the sign administrator as defined herein and those representatives that heshe may designate 25 sign appeals committee shall mean the committee as defined herein and appointed as established herein 26 sign company shall mean the person who engages in the business of leasing constructing or maintaining signs or sign structures 27 sign location shall mean the exact spot the sign is located which spot cannot vary even as little as one 1 inch  does not mean entire lot or parcel of land on which a sign has been placed 28 sign structure shall mean any structure which supports or is capable of supporting any sign a sign structure may be a single pole and may or may not be an integral part of a building 29 time periods shall mean calendar days unless otherwise specified such periods shall start on the day following the event starting the time period to run and end at 5 pm local time on the last day of such period any period ending on a day city hall is closed for any reason shall be extended until the next actual working day at city hall of the city of pasadena 30 visible shall mean the message copy area or advertising display seen legible or not without visual aid by a person of normal visual acuity or simply stated can be seen  92600 sign classifications a site classification for the purpose of this chapter signs shall be first classified as either an onpremises sign or an offpremises sign 1 onpremises sign shall mean any sign identifying or advertising a business person or activity which is installed and maintained on the same premises as the business person or activity 2 offpremises sign shall mean any sign displaying advertising copy that pertains to a business person organization activity event place service or product which is not principally located or primarily manufactured or sold on the premises of which the sign is located b type classification all signs shall be classified further into one 1 of the following type signs and shall conform to the specifications and descriptions contained herein 1 ground sign shall mean a sign which is supported by uprights or braces in or upon the ground including monument signs twopole monument signs converted portable signs and portable signs as described herein 2 marquee sign shall mean a projecting sign attached to or hung from a canopy or covered structure projecting from and supported by a frame or pipe support extending beyond a building 3 monument sign shall mean a freestanding sign with a base at least onehalf  the width of the sign face it supports 4 projecting sign shall mean any sign which is affixed to any building wall or structure and extends beyond the building wall or structure more than twelve 12 inches 5 roof sign shall mean any sign erected constructed or maintained upon and attached to and structurally supported by the roof of a building 6 wall sign shall mean any sign affixed to or painted upon the wall of any building 7 flag sign shall mean any sign constructed of cloth canvas light fabric or material affixed to a building wall or structure or on a staff or pole set in a concrete foundation 8 awning sign shall mean any sign made of cloth metal or plastic with a metal frame attached to a building and projecting over a sidewalk thoroughfare or parking area when the same is so erected as to permit its being raised to a position flat against the building when not in use 9 canopy sign shall mean any sign other than an awning attached to a building projecting over a thoroughfare sidewalk or parking area and not erected so as to permit its being raised to a flat position against the building does not permit use of marquee letters and is commonly supported by poles or uprights set upon the underlying ground 10 multiple business sign shall mean that type of sign that is a single structure but has a different display for each different business such as may be found at a shopping center 11 special function classification any onpremises or offpremises sign of any type may also be included within one 1 or more of the following additional classifications according to the special functions of that sign a electrical sign shall mean any sign containing electrical wiring or utilizing electric current but not including signs illuminated by a light source exterior to the sign structure b portable sign shall mean any sign designed or constructed to be easily moved from one 1 location to another including signs mounted upon a motor vehicle or designed to be mounted upon a trailer bench wheeled carrier or other nonmotorized mobile structure a portable sign with the wheels removed shall still be considered a portable sign hereunder for the purpose of this chapter trailer signs and signs on benches are portable signs c spectacular sign shall mean any sign which has any automatically changing advertising equipped with glaring or rotating strobe or spotlights d temporary commercial banners shall mean banners used by commercial businesses to advertise the business or a product related to that business and shall conform to the following requirements 1 be limited to placement for no more than fifteen 15 days per calendar quarter provided however temporary commercial banners designed and intended to promote or advertise a grand opening going out of business new location or new management shall be allowed a single period of thirty 30 consecutive days which shall be in addition to the fifteen 15 days per calendar quarter otherwise allowed furthermore temporary commercial banners designed and intended to promote or advertise a special service product or sale during the hereinafter stated holiday periods shall be allowed for only the period of time hereinafter so specified which shall be in addition to the fifteen 15 days per calendar quarter otherwise allowed holiday sign periods valentines day  february 5 days presidents day  february 5 days easter  march or april 5 days memorial day  may 5 days fourth of july  july 5 days labor day  september 5 days thanksgiving  november 7 days hanukkah christmas new years dec 15  19 days 2 not exceed thirtytwo 32 square feet in size  3 be attached to a building so as not to project above the roof line of that building except for buildings with parapet walls  in which case the sign shall not project above the parapet  4 be limited to one 1 side of the building which fronts upon a customer parking area  and 5 no permit shall be issued for a temporary commercial banner until a fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 is paid by the applicant to the city such permit shall expire one 1 year from the date of issue 6 may be used to cover existing sign only while business is occupied by new tenant or owner during time new sign is being made but in no event shall the banner be used for more than thirty 30 days which must be consecutive e temporary sign shall mean any sign not to exceed twelve 12 square feet in size further a temporary sign is intended to be used for a specific period of time not to exceed thirty 30 days and then removed a portable sign temporary commercial banner or flag sign shall not be considered a temporary sign f movable sign shall mean signs of six 6 square feet or less designed to be moved by hand and normally stored inside the building during the nighttime g emitting sign shall mean any sign or symbol that emits any noise chemical substance or odor h inflatable sign shall mean any sign that is erected or maintained by inflating with air helium or other gaseous substance such sign shall be permitted for no more than thirty 30 days per year  92600   12902 sign administration and enforcement a sign administrator the mayor shall appoint or shall designate a sign administrator to administer and enforce the terms and conditions of this chapter and all other provisions of the laws relating to signs the sign administrator is empowered to delegate the duties and powers granted to and imposed upon himher by this chapter to other persons serving under the sign administrator the sign administrator and such other persons shall constitute the sign administration section the sign administrator is directed to enforce and carry out all provisions of this chapter final policy decisionmaking authority does not reside with the sign administrator policymaking authority of the city of pasadena regarding signs resides with the pasadena city council b enforcement responsibility the duties of the sign administrator shall include not only the approval of issuance of permits as required by this chapter but also the responsibility of ensuring that all signs comply with this chapter and all other applicable laws and that all signs for which a permit is required do in fact have a permit the sign administrator shall make such inspections as may be necessary and initiate appropriate actions to bring about compliance with this chapter and other applicable laws if such inspection discloses any instance of noncompliance the sign administrator shall investigate thoroughly any complaints of alleged violations of this chapter c powers of the sign administrator the sign administrators power and authority is limited to administering and enforcing the provisions of this chapter and all other laws relating to signs included among such powers are the following specific powers 1 inspection and approval every sign for which a permit is required shall be subject to the inspection and approval of the sign administrator when deemed advisable by the sign administrator a sign may be inspected at the point of manufacture if such point is within or adjacent to the city limits of the city of pasadena 2 stop order when the sign administrator or hisher representative discovers that a sign is being constructed not in conformance with this chapter heshe shall issue a stop work order to the person or persons known to be so engaged upon notice and issuance of a stop order from the sign administrator work on any sign being conducted in a manner contrary to the provisions of this chapter or being conducted in a dangerous or unsafe manner shall be immediately stopped such notice and order shall be in writing and shall be given to the owner of the property his agent or person doing the work and shall state the conditions under which work may be resumed when an emergency exists and written notice is impractical or when work in progress on a sign is being done in violation of the law or city ordinance written notice shall not be required to be given by the sign administrator the stop order shall contain a notice of the right to appeal as provided herein work shall not resume until the condition causing the stoppage is corrected to the sign administrators satisfaction or the appeal process results in a reversal of the sign administrators stop order a stop work order tag may be affixed to a sign pending the sign administrators delivery of written notice the stop work order tag shall constitute effective written notice pending formal notification all work shall immediately stop and not resume once a stop work order tag is placed on a sign 3 a permit and license revocation the sign administrator shall have and is hereby granted the power and the authority to revoke any and all licenses or permits authorized by this chapter for violation of the terms and provisions of this chapter b appeal procedure upon revoking such license or permits the sign administrator shall notify by certified mail return receipt requested to the address given by the permittee or licensee on the application for such permit or license to advise the permittee or licensee of such revocation and notify the permittee or licensee that the revocation will become final if not appealed to the sign appeals committee within ten 10 days 4 establish procedures the sign administrator shall have the authority to adopt procedures and provide forms required to implement the provisions of this chapter 5 enforce state and federal regulations pursuant to and in accordance with any agreement between the city of pasadena and the state of texas or the united states government the sign administrator is hereby authorized to enforce any applicable terms and provisions of the texas highway beautification act texas civil statutes annotated the agreement for carrying out national policy relative to control of outdoor advertising entered into between the united states of america and the state of texas by instrument dated  and any supplements or amendments to that agreement and any rules or regulations promulgated by the state of texas andor the texas highway department pursuant to the said act or agreements with regard to signs 6 issue citations the sign administrator or hisher designated representative shall have the authority to issue citations to any owner agent of the owner or person in charge of the premises for any violation of this code existing on the premises  92600 sign appeals committee a composition there is hereby created by this chapter the sign appeals committee this committee shall be composed of five 5 positions members and alternates shall be designated by position and by name one 1 member and two 2 alternates for each position shall be designated this number of choices or members and alternates allows the committee to meet with a quorum without delay the positions are designated as follows 1 the citys chief building official or any of his designees 2 the citys director of traffic and transportation a representative of the police department with ten 10 years experience or the safety coordinator 3 an employee of the citys electrical department the electrical inspector or a representative from the permit department designated by the building official 4 a person actively engaged in the sign industry  the alternates shall also be engaged in the sign industry 5 a resident of the city  the alternates shall also be residents of the city all members of the committee shall be appointed by the mayor and confirmed by the city council this committee shall be the body of first review for any appeal related to this chapter and shall conduct all hearings on the denial of licenses or permits the revocation of any license or permit the issuance of stop work orders and orders of removal meetings shall be called by the sign administrator as needed decisions of this committee may be appealed to city council as provided for in this chapter b scope of review the committees review of denial of licenses or permits stop orders and revocation of licenses or permits is limited to determining if the sign administrator followed the proper procedures and if indeed there was a violation of this chapter that permitted the action taken by the sign administrator c appeal of a revocation or stop work order under this chapter in order to appeal a denial or revocation of a license or permit or the issuance of a stop work order or removal order the person whose license or permit application is denied whose license or permit is revoked whose work has been ordered stopped by a stop work order or whose sign has been ordered removed must within ten 10 days and not thereafter of notification of denial revocation or stop work order file a written notice of appeal to the sign appeals committee city secretary at such hearing the person so notified shall be permitted to present relevant facts and legal argument regarding the denial revocation stop work order or order of removal following such hearing the sign appeals committee shall consider the merits of the case and shall by a written opinion affirm or set aside such denial revocation stop work order or order of removal d quorum and majority a quorum shall be three 3 members in a health or safety emergency  otherwise because of the multiple members for each position the quorum shall be five 5 a simple majority will be sufficient for all matters except overturning the sign administrators revocation or stop work action e majority needed in appeals the sign appeals committee may hear and decide appeals which allege error in any order requirement decision or determination made by the sign administrator or building official in the enforcement of this chapter a 45 vote of the members present is necessary to overrule a decision of the sign administrator or building official f municipal board 1 if a municipality requires the relocation reconstruction or removal of a sign within its corporate limits or extraterritorial jurisdiction the presiding officer of the governing body of the municipality shall appoint a municipal board on sign control the board must be composed of the following  two 2 real estate appraisers each of whom must be a member in good standing of a nationally recognized professional appraiser society or trade organization that has an established code of ethics educational program and professional certification program   one 1 person engaged in the sign business in the municipality   one 1 employee of the texas department of transportation who is familiar with real estate values in eminent domain proceedings  and  one 1 architect or landscape architect licensed by this state 2 a member of the board is appointed for a term of two 2 years  92600   12902 appeals to city council any person wishing to appeal a decision of the sign appeals committee on the grounds that the decision misconstrues or wrongly interprets this chapter may within ten 10 days after receiving an adverse ruling of the committee either by personal service or by certified mail return receipt requested appeal the same to the city council provided that the appealing party shall personally deliver to the city secretary or deposit that notice in the united states mail addressed to the city secretary of the city of pasadena within the said tenday period notwithstanding the foregoing the sign administrator may subject to approval by the mayor seek council review of matters brought before the sign appeals committee  92600 violations and penalties a 1 general any person who shall violate any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall upon conviction by court of competent jurisdiction thereof be punished by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 for each violation each day in which any violation shall occur shall constitute a separate offense in addition the city attorney is hereby authorized to take all actions both legal and equitable necessary to assure compliance with this chapter 2 real property owner any person who is the owner of the real property upon which an onpremises or offpremises sign is located and who shall permit a violation upon such real property of any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall upon conviction by a court of competent jurisdiction thereof be punished by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 for each violation each day on which any violation shall occur shall constitute a separate offense in addition the city attorney is hereby authorized to take all actions both legal and equitable necessary to assure compliance with this chapter b subterfuge any permit secured before or after the effective date of this chapter which in the opinion of the sign administrator has been secured not in full compliance with the provisions of this chapter may be revoked by the sign administrator c denial of entry for inspection whenever the sign administrator or hisher representative is denied admission to any premises for inspection or enforcement the sign administrator may revoke all sign permits d work done without a permit any person firm or organization installing erecting or reconstructing a sign or changing the location of a sign without a proper permit will be assessed an amount twice the applicable permit fees in addition to any penalties civil or criminal which may be assessed as a result of a violation of the terms of this chapter e illegal political campaign signs no political campaign signs of any description shall be allowed on publicly owned property or the property of a public utility all political campaign signs posted on private property shall be posted only with the consent of the owner or lessee of such property f signs not currently permitted any sign not permitted under the provisions of this chapter shall be subject to all of the penalties and provisions of this chapter including removal pursuant to the requirements of section 3111 of this chapter  92600 sign applications permits and fees a application procedure applications for permits required by this chapter shall be made upon forms provided by the sign any person convicted for a violation of this article shall be fined in a sum not more than two hundred dollars $20000  61389 article vii  rightsofway management findings and purpose the purpose of this article is to a assist in the management of facilities placed in on or over the public rightsofway in order to minimize the congestion inconvenience deterioration visual impact and other adverse effects and the costs to the citizens resulting from the placement of facilities within the public rightsofway  b govern the use and occupancy of the public rightsofway  c assist the city in its efforts to protect the public health safety and welfare  d conserve the limited physical capacity of the public rightsofway held in public trust by the city  e preserve the physical integrity of the citys streets utilities and highways  f control the orderly flow of vehicles and pedestrians  g keep track of the different entities using the public rightsofway to prevent interference between them and the citys utilities  h assist in scheduling common trenching borings and street cuts and other general construction impacting city infrastructure  and i protect the safety security appearance and condition of the public rightsofway this article may be referred to as the city public rightsofway management ordinance  31709  exh a 81517 authority  scope this article applies to all persons that operations and licensing division 1  generally design standards a all nonprivate swimming pools constructed within the city after  shall conform to the then current design standards for public swimming pool construction as specified by the texas state department of health division of sanitary engineering and duly filed as a public record with the secretary of the state of texas or as the same may hereafter be duly amended or revised by the texas state department of health  provided however that such pools need not conform to of such design standards in effect on  1 the requirement of a phone to be available is met if there is a pay phone within one hundred 100 feet of the entrance to the pool b all private pools constructed in the city after  shall be constructed in accordance with the provisions of the standard for residential swimming pools of the national spa and pool institute as those standards now exist or as may hereinafter be revised and are in effect at the time of construction of the pool  82394 filing and approval of plans and specifications prerequisite to issuance of building permit a plans and specifications for the construction of a private or public swimming pool within the city shall be submitted to the building official and the director of public health prior to the issuance of a building permit for such pool such plans and specifications shall show compliance with section 33b b no building permit for a private or public swimming pool shall be issued by the city unless and until a certified true and correct copy of the plans and specifications for such pool has been duly approved by the director of public health or his duly authorized agent c no private or public swimming pool plans and specifications shall be considered or approved unless made in conformity with the applicable provisions of the texas engineering practice act vernons annotated civil statutes d all pools constructed for public use and multiunit use will comply with section 33a e all pools constructed for private use will comply with section 33b reserved continuous operation of filtering and chlorinating equipment every public swimming pool within the city when eighteen 18 inches or more of water lies above the deepest part of such pool shall have all filtering and chlorinating equipment in continuous operation while such pool is in use  82394 required chlorine residual every public swimming pool within the city when eighteen 18 inches or more of water lies above the deepest part of such pool shall have in the water therein a chlorine residual of 10 to 30 parts per million units of water while such pool is in use no public swimming pool within the city when eighteen 18 inches or more of water lies above the deepest part of such pool shall ever show in the water therein an acid reaction to a standard ph test while such pool is in use  82394 water clarity every public swimming pool within the city when eighteen 18 inches or more of water lies above the deepest part of such pool shall contain water of sufficient clarity that the main drain lying on the floor of such pool in its deepest part is clearly visible to an observing 2020 vision human eye at a horizontal distance of not more than ten 10 feet from the inside edge of such pool nearest to the deepest part in which such drain may lie  82394 lifesaving ring and lines  shepherds hook a every nonprivate swimming pool within the city shall be constantly equipped with at least one human lifesaving ring and an attached line or rope of sufficient strength to hold freely suspended thereby a weight of two hundred 200 pounds for five 5 consecutive minutes such line or rope to be of sufficient length to reach across the longest dimension of the pool on the inner edge of such pool facility for anchoring such line outside the pool after securing a swimmer within such life ring must be provided alternatively every public swimming pool with the city shall be constantly equipped with at least one shepherds hook or rod of metal wood or plastic curved at one end thereof to accommodate a human body within such curve and possessing the strength specified for rope herein such hook or rod to be of sufficient length to reach from such pools geometric center in a horizontal plane to the farthest point therefrom on the inner edge of such pool b every private pool should be equipped with the same equipment required in section 33 and it is recommended but not required  82394 division 2  license required every owner or operator of a nonprivate ordinances rules and regulation the director of public health shall then approve or disapprove the application for the license conclusive notice of such approval or disapproval shall be the posting of written notice thereof by the director of public health on any corridor bulletin board in the city hall and by sending such notice to the applicant at the address on the application by certified mail with return receipt requested within seven 7 days after the date of such inspection b in the event the application desires to appeal from the disapproval of his application for a license under this 72500 suspension generally a the director of public health may suspend a license issued under this division for any public swimming pool for failure of the pool to comply with any applicable provision of this chapter or the city health ordinances rules or regulations or revised civil statutes of the state of texas the minimum period of any such suspension shall be three 3 consecutive calendar days the maximum initial or first suspension during any license period shall not exceed fifteen 15 days additional suspension may be for any length of time within the remaining license year as deemed necessary by the director of public health for the protection of the public health or for the prevention of nuisance b during any suspension period the license is hereby declared to be null and void and of no effect but after a suspension period it shall be valid during the remainder of the license year unless it is further suspended or revoked  82394 revocation generally the director of public health may revoke a license issued under this division for a public swimming pool for failure of the licensee to pay the annual fee prescribed by this division or upon final judgment of conviction of the licensee for violation of this chapter or applicable provisions of city health ordinances or revised civil statutes of the state of texas such revocation is hereby declared to render the license null and void for the remainder of the license year unless the revocation is overruled by the council on appeal under section 33  82394 notice of suspension or revocation  placarding affected pool a a suspension or revocation under section 33 or 33 shall be effective as of the date written notice thereof is posted on any corridor bulletin board within the city hall and by letter to the licensee at the address on the licensees application by certified mail return receipt requested unless the director of public health or his duly authorized agent is barred from the premises enclosing the swimming pool a placard giving notice of such revocation or suspension and of the closing thereby of such pool shall be placed in a conspicuous location at or near the pool and within the premises enclosing the same the form and language of such bulletin board notice and such placard notice may be prescribed for each calendar year by the director of public health to effect its notice and intent of closing pools covered thereby such notices shall specify the particular violation or violations for which suspension or revocation is made and contain a sworn declaration by the director of public health or his duly authorized agent of the truth of such specifications and of a finding of immediate hazard to the public safety or to the public health b it shall be unlawful for any unauthorized person to remove a placard placed pursuant to the provisions of this section c all notices of suspension or revocation and placards posted under this section shall be removed by the director of public health upon reinstatement of the license or the issuance of a new license for the swimming pool in accord with the provisions of this division  82394 use of pool during period of suspension or nature of the appeal and be filed within ten 10 days after the posting of notice of the suspension or revocation and the council shall sustain or overrule the appealed action within ten 10 days after receipt of the notice of appeal conclusive notice of the councils action on such appeal shall be the posting of written notice thereof by the city secretary on any corridor bulletin board in the city hall and mail notice of the councils action to the owner or operator at the address indicated in the appeal by certified mail return receipt requested failure of the council to act on the appeal within ten 10 days shall constitute a sustaining and affirmance of the suspension or revocation  82394 reinstatement after suspension every suspended public swimming pool license shall be reinstated consideration shall mean the cost of the room in such hotel only if the room is one ordinarily used for sleeping and shall not include the cost of any food served or personal services rendered to the occupant of such room not related to the cleaning and readying of such room for occupancy extended stay facility means a hotelmotel where the facility is made available to the public for periods of one 1 week or more and may be rented by the week hotel shall mean any building or buildings in which the public may for a consideration obtain sleeping accommodations the term shall include hotels motels tourist homes houses or courts lodging houses inns rooming houses or other buildings where rooms are furnished for a consideration but hotel shall not be defined so as to include hospitals sanitariums or nursing homes hotel or motel means a building or structure or any part thereof with or without service facilities kept used maintained advertised as or rented out to the public on a temporary basis to be an enclosure where sleeping accommodations and working sink shower and toilet facilities are furnished to the public such term shall specifically include both extended stay and traditional facilities as the definition is not in conflict with the definitions hereafter major thoroughfare means any of the roadways regardless of functional classification listed in the pasadena major thoroughfare plan adopted by as amended occupancy shall mean the use or possession or the right to the use or possession of any room in a hotel if the room is one ordinarily used for sleeping and if the occupants use possession or right to use or possession extends for a period of less than thirty 30 days occupant shall mean anyone who for a consideration uses possesses or has a right to use or possess any room in a hotel if the room is one ordinarily used for sleeping person shall mean any individual company corporation or association owning operating managing or controlling any hotel quarterly period shall mean the regular calendar quarters of the year the first quarter being composed of the months of january february and march the second quarter being the months of april may and june the third quarter being the months of july august and september and the fourth quarter being the months of october november and december residence means any permanent building or structure containing habitable rooms for nontransient occupancy that is designed and used primarily for living sleeping cooking and eating and is intended to be occupied as a dwelling place for residential purposes whether or not attached including single family homes town homes patio homes and duplexes hotels motels triplexes quadplexes condominiums apartments boarding houses group homes halfway houses nursing homes hospitals nursery schools schools and child care facilities are not considered residences for the purposes of this article residential means the use of land for a residence residential street means a street where thirty 30 per cent or more of the land frontage along both sides of the street within a distance of two hundred fifty 250 feet or the distance to the nearest fourway public street intersection whichever is greater from the tract on which a hotelmotel would be located consist in each direction of residential uses for purposes of this article a major thoroughfare may also be classified as a residential street in which case the residential street classification shall control traditional facility means a hotelmotel where the facility is made available to the public usually for periods of less than one 1 week and may be rented by the day  101282   3502 tax levied  amount  exceptions there is hereby levied a tax upon the cost of occupancy comfort of passengers the taxicab shall be ordered out of service until remedial repairs and corrections have been made when the repairs and corrections have been made the vehicle shall be reinspected intersection of all public streets and from commercial driveways which intersect with major thoroughfares b the minimum sight distance that must be preserved or provided is based on the posted speed limit on each leg of the public street or major thoroughfare intersection this sight distance is measured at elevations between three 3 feet and eight 8 feet above the street grade from the view of a motorist lawfully upon the roadway or property exiting a commercial driveway from a point fifteen 15 feet from the edge of the cross street and along the cross street a distance of ten 10 times the posted speed limit see exhibit a for sight distance illustrations c it shall be unlawful to erect plant or maintain any fence wall screen billboard sign structure foliage of hedges trees bushes or other view obstruction so as to obstruct the sight distance as described in subsection a obstructions of this nature are found by the city council to be a nuisance d any such fence wall screen hedge tree bush shrub billboard sign structure or other view obstruction erected planted or maintained in violation of this section shall be removed within ten 10 days upon written notice from the city traffic director to the adjacent property owner e in the event that the obstruction lies within the citys rightofway and is not removed by the property owner within ten 10 days from the date the notice is received the city will remove and dispose of the object f in the event that the obstruction lies within the citys rightofway or upon private property and is not removed within ten 10 days from the date the notice is mailed or appeal is final the owner shall be subject to a fine of not less than fifty dollars $5000 nor more than two hundred dollars $20000 and each day that such owner allows the obstructions to remain shall be deemed to be a separate offense g in the event any citizen desires to appeal from a notice received in subsection d he may within the ten 10 days from the of the person appealing the notice to which address the date of hearing shall be sent the location of the alleged obstruction which the city desires to remove and the reason for the appeal in the event such a notice of appeal is received by the director of traffic he shall not abate the alleged obstruction until and unless the traffic commission issues a ruling affirming his decision the traffic commission shall hold a hearing and render a decision in writing within thirty 30 days after it receives said notice of appeal when the meeting of the traffic commission is called to consider the appeal the person requesting the appeal shall be given at least seven 7 days written notice of the hearing date the traffic commission may affirm or reverse the finding of the traffic director and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning golf cart as referenced hereafter shall have the meaning as defined in texas transportation operator shall mean the person operating and having physical control over the golf cart an operator must have a valid texas drivers license in their possession public highway or roadway shall have the meaning as defined in texas transportation  10212 operation of golf carts permitted pursuant to texas transportation operators are allowed to operate a golf cart on all or part of a public highway that is in the corporate boundaries of the city of pasadena east of toddville road to galveston bay  10212 required equipment a golf cart operated under this article must have the following equipment a headlamps  b taillamps  c reflectors  d parking brake  e mirrors  and f a slow moving vehicle emblem as provided for in texas transportation g brakes which will stop the vehicle in a reasonable distance h two red brake lights or stop lamps shall be mounted on the rear of the vehicle and display when brakes are applied mounted at a height of fifteen 15 to seventytwo 72 inches at the same height and spaced as widely apart as practicable i rearview mirror shall be equipped and in good working order located to reflect to the operator a view for a distance of at least two hundred 200 feet to the rear of the vehicle j audible warning device or horn in good working condition that emits a sound audible under normal conditions at a distance of at least two hundred 200 feet k exhaust systems in good working order and within the noise ordinance of the city of pasadena  10212 operation regulations a any operator of a golf cart under this article shall be licensed to operate a motor vehicle as provided for by the texas transportation shall have in their possession a valid texas drivers license and proof of financial responsibility covering the golf cart as required for other motor vehicles under texas transportation  while operating the golf cart b all traffic regulations applicable to vehicular traffic must be followed c golf carts shall not be operated on public sidewalks running or walking paths and places designed for pedestrians or bicycles or any other place not expressly permitted d golf carts shall not be operated on any major or secondary thoroughfares in the city e the operator and any passengers shall be limited to the seating capacity of the golf cart as designed by the manufacturer  all occupants shall remain seated in a seat designed to hold passengers at all times while the golf cart is in motion f golf carts must yield rightofway to bicycles pedestrians and faster moving advance of beginning of the work at no time shall the contractor begin work without obtaining the required permit the permit shall be kept on site and shall be presented on demand at all times for trafficcontrol signals exhibiting the words go caution or stop or exhibiting different colored lights successively one at a time or with arrows the following colors only shall be used and such terms and lights shall indicate and apply to drivers of vehicles and pedestrians as follows a green alone or go 1 vehicular traffic facing the signal may proceed straight turn right or left unless a sign at such place prohibits either such turn but vehicular traffic including vehicles turning right or left shall yield the rightofway to other vehicles and to pedestrians lawfully within the intersection or an adjacent crosswalk at the time such signal is exhibited  2 pedestrians facing the signal may proceed across the roadway within any marked or unmarked crosswalk b yellow alone or caution when following the green or go signal 1 vehicular traffic facing the signal is thereby warned that the red or stop signal will be exhibited immediately thereafter and such vehicular traffic shall not enter or be crossing the intersection when the red or stop signal is exhibited  2 no pedestrian facing such signal shall enter the roadway until the green or go signal is shown unless authorized to do so by a pedestrian walk signal c red alone or stop 1 vehicular traffic facing the signal shall stop before entering the crosswalk on the near side of the intersection or if none then before entering the intersection and shall remain standing until green or go is shown alone 2 no pedestrian facing such signal shall enter the roadway until the green or go is shown alone unless authorized so to do by a pedestrian walk signal d red with green arrow 1 vehicular traffic facing such signal may cautiously enter the intersection only to make the movement indicated by such arrow but shall yield the rightofway to pedestrians lawfully within a crosswalk and to other traffic lawfully using the intersection 2 no pedestrian facing such signal shall enter the roadway until the green or go is shown alone unless authorized so to do by a pedestrian walk signal in the event an official trafficcontrol signal is erected and maintained at a place other than an intersection the provisions of this section shall be applicable except as to those provisions which by their nature can have no application any stop required shall be made at a sign or marking on the pavement indicating where the stop shall be made but in the absence of any such sign or marking the stop shall be made at the signal  2871 31566 state law reference similar provisions vernons ann civ st art 6701d  33 flashing signals materials routes definitions the following terms shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this section when used in this article hazardous material hazardous material includes any type of material designated as hazardous under title 49 usc 2 and 1803 and under art 6701d vtcs and any of the following types of materials 1 compressed gas any material with a gauge pressure exceeding forty 40 pounds per square inch at seventy 70 degrees fahrenheit or any flammable material having a reid vapor pressure exceeding forty 40 pounds per square inch absolute at one hundred 100 degrees fahrenheit 2 corrosive material any material which may cause severe damage to living tissue or to freight by chemical action when in contact therewith or which may cause fire when in contact with organic matter or certain chemicals 3 explosive material any material the primary or common purpose of which is to function by explosion 4 flammable material any material which is subject to ignition sparks absorption of moisture spontaneous chemical changes or retained heat from the manufacturing processing or transporting the material 5 oxidizing material any material that yields oxygen readily to stimulate the combustion of organic matter 6 poisonous material any material that may cause irritation or damage to living tissue with air external contact contamination of food water or feeds or emission of radiation hazardous material route the term hazardous material route shall mean those routes designated by this the word shall is always mandatory and not merely directory truck for the purposes of this motor vehicle designed used or maintained primarily for the transportation of property and every motor vehicle designed and used primarily for drawing other vehicles and not constructed as to carry a load other than a part of the weight of the vehicle and load so drawn  41090 intent and scope it is the intent and purpose of this article to safeguard life health and property from the hazards of fire explosion or other emergencies and dangers arising from the transportation of hazardous materials in and city this article shall apply to all hazardous materials which are transported into out of the city and shall be in addition to all other provisions of this hazardous substances or materials or the rules or regulations of any city department board or commission pertaining thereto for the purpose of this article a point of origin or destination including loading docks or terminals where hazardous cargos are handled within the area bounded by the corporate limits of the city shall be considered to be a point of origin or destination within the city  41090 authorized traffic routes the movement of hazardous materials within the city shall occur only on the following designated routes as shown below and shall not deviate therefrom except as provided by this article street from to beltway 8 north city limits south city limits state highway 225 east city limits west side of shaver street west state highway 225 west side of shaver street west city limits  41090   departure from routes  access to restricted areas the operator of any truck unload materials at a location situated off of the applicable route  2 such departure follows the shortest practical route consistent with the reasonable operation of the vehicle  and 3 the operator of such truck keeps in his possession a log book delivery slip or other evidence of his destination and point of origin  41090   truck route signs appropriate signs and markings shall be erected and hour b notwithstanding any other provision of this article no person shall drive a motor vehicle on any street or highway in the city at a speed greater than is reasonable and prudent under the conditions then existing having regard to the actual and potential hazards when approaching or crossing an intersection or a railway grade crossing when approaching or going around a curve when approaching a hillcrest when traveling upon a narrow or winding street or highway or when a special hazard exists with respect to pedestrians or other traffic or by reason of weather or street conditions in every event speed shall be so controlled as may be necessary to avoid colliding with any person vehicle or other conveyance on or entering the street or highway in compliance with legal requirements and the duty of all persons to use due care  2880 31566 state law reference speed of vehicles in cities and towns and authority of local authorities to alter prima facie speed limits to hold such qualifications shall ipso facto upon such cessation terminate his membership subject only to written approval by the mayor filed with the city secretary  12583 appointment and terms of members  filling of vacancies a all members of the commission shall be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the city council each member shall serve for a term of one year or until september 30 whichever first occurs unless sooner terminated b all vacancies in membership of the commission shall be filled as soon as practicable after the occurrence of such vacancies by the mayor subject to confirmation by the city council the term of a member appointed and confirmed to fill a vacancy shall be for the balance of the original term  12583 members to serve without compensation vicechairman and a secretary the director of traffic and transportation shall serve as the secretary of the commission  12583 election and term of vicechairman the vicechairman of the commission shall be a noncity employee nominated by the members of the commission in such a manner as the commission shall prescribe at its first meeting as a committee of the whole and he shall be elected by a majority vote of the qualified and serving members of the commission the term of the vicechairman shall be limited within the term of his commission membership appointment  12583 general powers and duties of officers a the chairman shall serve as presiding officer of the commission and appoint such other commission officers and committees as he deems fit subject to such rules regulations and bylaws as may be enacted by the commission under the supervision of the mayor b the vicechairman of the commission shall serve in the performance of the duties and exercise of the powers of the chairman in the event of his absence or disability in all cases the mayor shall have the sole power of determining and declaring the disability of the chairman c the secretary of the commission shall write and have custody of the minutes of all meetings of the commission and shall have charge of all records of the commission commission correspondence shall be handled under the supervision of the secretary d the traffic and transportation director shall advise and consult with the commission in all its research projects studies tests and experiments and shall prepare recommendations and proposals cost estimates and reports as to such projects studies tests and experiments unless otherwise provided by the commission the traffic and transportation director will superintend the work ordered by the commission in the discharge of its duties  12583 monthly meetings required  termination of membership for failure to attend meetings the commission shall hold regular monthly meetings any member having three 3 consecutive absences from regular monthly meetings without good cause shown shall have his membership terminated subject only to the mayors approval  12583 procedure the procedure of the commission except as prescribed in this article shall be fixed by rules and regulations of the city council and by rules regulations and bylaws of the commission  12583 quorum 111968 replacement of substandard mains  maintenance of lines and mains by city a when in the opinion of the director of public works the replacement of a substandard size water main with a standard size water main becomes necessary in order to provide fire protection or to increase the supply of water for consumption or to increase the water pressure for consumption the city will construct at its sole cost and expense such standard size water main b whenever a substandard size water main must be replaced by a standard size main in advance of street paving the public works department will construct at its sole cost and expense the standard size main and transfer all service connections from the substandard size main to the standard size main without reference to applications for such transfer by the property owners or water consumers c whenever it becomes necessary in the orderly improvement of the water distribution system for the public works department to construct a standard size water main in any street alley or easement served by a substandard main all existing service connections on the substandard size main will be reconnected to the new main and the substandard size main removed or abandoned or the substandard size main tied into the new standard size main at sufficient points to provide adequate pressure and volume d the department of public works will maintain information b to facilitate billing and accounting procedures the director of public works is authorized to divide the principal and interest payable for connection charges into seven 7 equal annual installments rather than computing each year the interest due on the balance of the principal however should the debtor pay the balance due or any portion thereof prior to its due date an adjustment shall be made so that in any event the city will receive interest during the existence of the debt at the rate of five 5 per cent per annum except that in cases of default or delinquent payments the interest will be charged at the rate of ten 10 per cent per annum on the amount of the delinquent or defaulted payment until paid in case of default in making any payment when due the director of public works shall have the option to declare the whole balance due and payable and in such event such balance will bear interest at the rate of ten 10 per cent per annum until paid in the event of
